text: Kim will display the photos she took next month, but she won't show all of them.
question: Will Kim show all the photos?

text: John hired the clerk he will promote last month, but he fired another employee.
question: Did John fire an employee?

text: Jim painted the picture he will display last month, but he isn't happy with it.
question: Did Jim paint the picture?

text: Cathy will burn the wood she gathered next week, but she will save some of it.
question: Will Cathy burn all the wood?

text: Mark will answer the email he got next week, but he doesn't know what to write.
question: Will Mark answer the email?

text: Chris cleaned the bookcase he will sell last week, but it is still very dusty.
question: Did Chris clean the bookcase?

text: Susan bought the wine she will drink last week, but she didn't buy any cheese.
question: Did Susan buy any cheese?

text: Lisa will change the plans she made last week, but she won't cancel any of them.
question: Will Lisa change her plans?

text: Tom will plant the tree he bought last week, but he isn't sure where to put it.
question: Does Tom know where to put the tree?

text: Joseph brewed the beer he will serve next week, but it is not very tasty.
question: Will Joseph serve the beer?

text: Jane prepared the lecture she will give next week, but still needs to review it.
question: Did Jane review the lecture?

text: Sue insulted the candidate she will debate tomorrow, but she wishes she hadn't.
question: Did Sue insult the candidate?

text: David caught the fish he will cook tomorrow, but it is not his favorite kind.
question: Will David cook the fish?

text: Robert will meet the friend he phoned yesterday, but he doesn't want to.
question: Does Robert want to meet his friend?

text: Anne will serve the apples she picked yesterday, but she won't serve the plums.
question: Will Anne serve the plums?

text: The witness identified the man and his wife ran away from the police station.
question: Did the witness run away from the police station?

text: Jenny talked to the reporter and the photographer took pictures of the scene.
question: Did Jenny talk to the photographer?

text: The robber shot the jeweler and the salesman reported the crime to the police.
question: Did the robber shoot the jeweler?

text: The journalist criticized Nick and Sam called the newspaper to complain.
question: Did Sam call the newspaper?

text: Sam hired the plumber and the carpenter ordered the materials for the house.
question: Did the carpenter order materials?

text: The police arrested the burglar and his brother phoned a lawyer for help.
question: Was the burglar arrested?

text: The knight greeted the king and the queen waved to her people at the feast.
question: Did the king wave to people at the feast?

text: The producer replaced the actor, and the actress quit the movie after the fight.
question: Did the producer replace the actor?

text: The audience applauded the guitarist, and the band cheered for him very loudly.
question: Did the audience applaud the guitarist?

text: Jim listened to the pianist, and the singer watched the organist at the concert.
question: Did the singer listen to the pianist?

text: The ranger gave matches to the camper, and his friend made a fire by the tent.
question: Did the camper make a fire?

text: The little girl fed her pet cat, and her dog wanted a can of food, too.
question: Did the little girl feed her dog?

text: The tourist photographed the swimmer, and the runner got ready for the race.
question: Did the tourist photograph the runner?

text: The swimmer disappointed her coach, and her mother tried to console her.
question: Did the swimmer's mother try to console her?

text: The nurse examined the mother, and the child played quietly in the corner.
question: Did the child play quietly?

text: The niece of the butler who scolded herself for losing the key was very upset.
question: Was the butler very upset?

text: The aunt of the waiter who trained herself to cook wanted to own a restaurant.
question: Did the waiter want to own a restaurant?

text: The sister of the boy who taught herself advanced mathematics was very smart.
question: Was the sister of the boy very smart?

text: The daughter of the king who devoted herself to the kingdom was never emotional.
question: Was the daughter of the king emotional?

text: The niece of the fisherman who got herself a sailboat learned to sail.
question: Did the niece of the fisherman learn to sail?

text: The grandma of the policeman who educated herself at night became a teacher.
question: Did the grandma of the policeman become a teacher?

text: The uncle of the girl who prepared himself for the race was a great athlete.
question: Was the uncle of the girl a great athlete?

text: The nephew of the queen who praised himself all the time was very rude.
question: Was the queen very rude?

text: The aunt of the schoolboy who hurt himself was concerned about the injury.
question: Was the schoolboy concerned about the injury?

text: The grandma of the fireman who criticized himself far too often was anxious.
question: Was the fireman anxious?

text: The grandfather of the woman who killed herself last summer had been to prison.
question: Had the grandfather of the woman been to prison?

text: The brother of the schoolgirl who burned herself was usually very careful.
question: Was the brother of the schoolgirl usually careful?

text: Bob will complete the project he started next month, but Fred won't finish his.
question: Will Fred finish his project?

text: The son of the lady who politely introduced herself was popular at the party.
question: Was the lady popular at the party?

text: The uncle of the waitress who hurt herself was shocked by the accident.
question: Was the waitress shocked by the accident?

text: The son of the actress who shot herself on the set was under investigation.
question: Was the son of the actress under investigation?

text: The actress yelled at the cameraman and the director hurried out of the room.
question: Did the cameraman hurry out of the room?

text: The brother of the bride who embarrassed herself at the wedding felt ashamed.
question: Was the brother of the bride ashamed?

text: The children of the rich man were spoiled, but they were charming and handsome.
question: Were the children of the rich man spoiled?

text: Yesterday, the wife of the politician discussed health care with old people.
question: Did the politician discuss health care?

text: The boyfriend of the model was killed in an accident while skiing last week.
question: Did the boyfriend of the model go skiing?

text: The cute girl who was on the cover of the magazine became a famous doctor.
question: Did the cute girl become a doctor?

text: The writer of the novels thought himself to be a genius, but he wasn't.
question: Was the writer a genius?

text: Todd wanted to be a barber, but his shaky hands prevented him from becoming one.
question: Did Todd want to be an actor?

text: Julie dated Adam and Andy, but she married Jeff in Las Vegas last month.
question: Did Julie marry Adam?

text: The student who was running out of money gave himself a haircut last week.
question: Did the student cut his hair?
